page.title: 13The Durham Ox
page.content: Building thought to be about 150 to 200 years old and it has always been public house as far as knowledge goes. it was part of Crayke estate, until it changed hands and was extensively renovated in early 1960's. It has changed hands three times since then.. The land to rear of building and outbuildings was used as stockyard. The buildings have since been developed to form self catering cottages but retaining their original structure. it was renovated in style befitting its era and therefore is quite an unusual establishment. It takes residents in the tradition of country inns and also serves real ale. It has a busy dining room to cater for the influx of visitors to the area and the changing eating habits of local residents. Eventhough it attracts visitors it forms the hub of village
